cascom.jade.mtp.http
Class CascomGatewayServer

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      jade.mtp.http2.HTTPServer
          cascom.jade.mtp.http.CascomGatewayServer
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class CascomGatewayServer
extends HTTPServer

Class implementing the Cascom Messaging Gateway. Class uses CascomGWConnectionManager to handle connections between the gateway client and the gateway. Gateway extends HTTPServer, which uses the default (or user defined) ConnectionManager to handle connections between the gateway and the (non proxy client) agent platform MTP:s. This gateway should act like the original HTTP MTP but routes the messages to connected mobile agent platforms when needed.

Author:
Ahti Syreeni - TeliaSonera

Field Detail

SECURE_ACLCODING_PREFIX

public static final java.lang.String SECURE_ACLCODING_PREFIX
In CASCOM system, there can be encrypted messages. If such message cannot be delivered, it cannot be opened for creating error response. However, the encryption concerns only content and this prefix is added to the actual ACLCodec name. So, using the ACLCodec with name after this prefix, it should be possible to open the headers of encrypted aclmessage.

See Also:

getPlatformID

public java.util.Hashtable getClients()
Returns Hastable containing CascomGWConnectionManagers handling connections to mobile clients.

getConnectionManager

public ConnectionManager getConnectionManager()
Gets the ConnectionManager which handles connections related issues (HTTP-responses, opening and closing of connections etc.) to the other agent platforms. This ConnectionManager does not handle connections between mobile clients connecting to gateway.

getLogger

public jade.util.Logger getLogger()
Gets the logger for this class.

getACLCodecs

public java.util.Hashtable getACLCodecs()
